title: Akipō kōrōōyi pō Coronavirus
licenseNotes: Kimēētāsi ng’ālyoon nyoo ng’ulēy ng’aleechu, wōloo nyuun imuukēy iwal nkōō kuutiing’uung’ akiiyooytō nkōō oortin choo ng’ulēy’wōloo nyuun kimee-alta. Kimēē-āp ng’aleechu kulēku chookuuk. Mwooruu kilē kiisirēy Weiman Kou.
copyright: Copyright © 2020, Bible Translation and Literacy, Kenya
credits: Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow
summary: This book gives basic advice on dealing with the coronavirus COVID 19

11.enb: Mii kir AKOONG’O kipaat nyoo nyoolchinii isōwu akipō WŌLOO KUUNOOMTOOY KEEY kōrōōyi pō coronavirus
11.en: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

12.enb: Mii kir AKOONG’O kipaat nyoo nyoolchinii isōwu akipō WŌLOO KUUNOOMTOOY KEEY kōrōōyi pō coronavirus
12.en: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

27.enb: Kuunoomtooy keey kōrōōyi nēē raal nta kung’alaal :chiich kupka ng’ula

28.enb: Kuunoomtooy keey kōrōōyi nēē raal nta kung’alaal :chiich kupka ng’ula

29.enb: Ryoong’ēē miita 2 si nēē ng’at iriip keey māpēēchiin ng’ulēēpō chiich
29.en: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.

30.enb: Ryoong’ēē miita 2 si nēē ng’at iriip keey māpēēchiin ng’ulēēpō chiich
30.en: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.

37.enb: Nēē roo chiich nyoo roolēy / tirsyoonēy / mnyanaat
37.en: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

38.enb: Nēē roo chiich nyoo roolēy / tirsyoonēy / mnyanaat
38.en: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

39.enb: Tēē akwaaneek tukun choo tukēē keey sēr nkōō kuut. Muukēy kuroolchi nta kuutirsyoonchi tukuuchoochēē sikuriip piich walak choo lēēkitēēn
39.en: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.

40.enb: Tēē akwaaneek tukun choo tukēē keey sēr nkōō kuut. Muukēy kuroolchi nta kuutirsyoonchi tukuuchoochēē sikuriip piich walak choo lēēkitēēn
40.en: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.

47.enb: Mā kēēlē mnyanaat :inyeentee, mii kipaat kuriipēy keey
47.en: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

48.enb: Mā kēēlē mnyanaat :inyeentee, mii kipaat kuriipēy keey
48.en: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

49.enb: Muukēy kimnyaanaat :chiich wōloo nyuun moomii kiyoo ng’uutuuy kilē mnyaanaat, akuunoomtooy nyuun piich kōrōōyi
49.en: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

50.enb: Muukēy kimnyaanaat :chiich wōloo nyuun moomii kiyoo ng’uutuuy kilē mnyaanaat, akuunoomtooy nyuun piich kōrōōyi
50.en: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

51.enb: Karaam imētoorēē keey wōloo mii  :piich chaa chaang’, āmu mēēmuukēy isōwu kilē ng’oo nyoo mnyaanaat
51.en: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

52.enb: Karaam imētoorēē keey wōloo mii  :piich chaa chaang’, āmu mēēmuukēy isōwu kilē ng’oo nyoo mnyaanaat
52.en: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

59.enb: Tukun choo /kinyipirēy nkōō liipti nyēpō koropa

60.enb: Tukun choo /kinyipirēy nkōō liipti nyēpō koropa

67.enb: nkōō mpōsaang’ nyēpō kir nyoo itukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
67.en: & even on the outside of your face mask

68.enb: nkōō mpōsaang’ nyēpō kir nyoo itukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
68.en: & even on the outside of your face mask

79.enb: Muukēy kupēēchi saayiitiis walak ng’ula chēpō chiich nyoo mnyaanaat tukun walak kilēē…
79.en: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

80.enb: Muukēy kupēēchi saayiitiis walak ng’ula chēpō chiich nyoo mnyaanaat tukun walak kilēē…
80.en: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

87.enb: Nēē nam tukuuchu kimēēnkēt, aku nēē ng’at inam keey tokoch,
87.en: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

88.enb: Nēē nam tukuuchu kimēēnkēt, aku nēē ng’at inam keey tokoch,
88.en: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

89.enb: oor kipaat nyoo /kuuwoong’ēy kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi ku /kēēwuun tukuuchoochēē nkōō sāpuni nta /kēēpāyiisyēērō saakityaan nyoo /kuutiliilēē tukun.
89.en: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

90.enb: oor kipaat nyoo /kuuwoong’ēy kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi ku /kēēwuun tukuuchoochēē nkōō sāpuni nta /kēēpāyiisyēērō saakityaan nyoo /kuutiliilēē tukun.
90.en: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

91.enb: Nēē nam :kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi tukun kitēpēē saayitiis choo ng’ērin
91.en: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

92.enb: Nēē nam :kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi tukun kitēpēē saayitiis choo ng’ērin
92.en: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

97.en: Which is why it is also good to follow these

98.en: Which is why it is also good to follow these

99.en: wash with soap up to here

100.en: wash with soap up to here

105.enb: Kimeenam keey tokoch. (Nta inam chiich aka tokoch.) Nēē mārēy nama keey tokoch iwuun ēēruung’uung’ kukaraam kupok
105.en: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

106.enb: Kimeenam keey tokoch. (Nta inam chiich aka tokoch.) Nēē mārēy nama keey tokoch iwuun ēēruung’uung’ kukaraam kupok
106.en: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

107.enb: Tēēnō saayit nyoo yāmēy keey /keetuum tuumi mwoorēy kilē, “Kumwooruun kōōnkēy apoonyoon āmu kaakisuwa ēēruung’uung’” kunyil ārēēny
107.en: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

108.enb: Tēēnō saayit nyoo yāmēy keey /keetuum tuumi mwoorēy kilē, “Kumwooruun kōōnkēy apoonyoon āmu kaakisuwa ēēruung’uung’” kunyil ārēēny
108.en: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

115.en: wash the back of your hands

116.en: wash the back of your hands

119.enb: Nēē koo keenam keey kimēēwāriisyō, wuunō kipaat ēēruunēkuuk kukaraam nkōō sāpuni
119.en: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

120.enb: Nēē koo keenam keey kimēēwāriisyō, wuunō kipaat ēēruunēkuuk kukaraam nkōō sāpuni
120.en: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

121.enb: Nēē muukēē ku meenam mpō saang’ nyēpō kiyoonēē /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
121.en: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

122.enb: Nēē muukēē ku meenam mpō saang’ nyēpō kiyoonēē /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
122.en: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

125.enb: Kuutyaan nyoo āpuuy kōrōōy kinārēy nkōō or nyēpō kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut nēē /kuulaak kilōōwiit
125.en: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

126.enb: Kuutyaan nyoo āpuuy kōrōōy kinārēy nkōō or nyēpō kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut nēē /kuulaak kilōōwiit
126.en: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

127.enb: Nēē nur kipaat kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut iwiirta. Kimeelaak kiyoonēē kisiir pērēētuu akoong’o!
127.en: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

128.enb: Nēē nur kipaat kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut iwiirta. Kimeelaak kiyoonēē kisiir pērēētuu akoong’o!
128.en: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

139.enb: Kimaaramta āmiisyō, tukun choo /ki-āmiisyēērēē nkōō tōwulō
139.en: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

140.enb: Kimaaramta āmiisyō, tukun choo /ki-āmiisyēērēē nkōō tōwulō
140.en: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

141.enb: Mēēmuukēy :chiich kutiing’o keey kipkong’ tokoch mpō ntā kuutyam
141.en: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

142.enb: Mēēmuukēy :chiich kutiing’o keey kipkong’ tokoch mpō ntā kuutyam
142.en: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

143.enb: Nēē muukēē, ipāyiisyēērēē kipkong’ nyoo mā ēēr paani iyootēy akiikārēy kurkat.
143.en: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

144.enb: Nēē muukēē, ipāyiisyēērēē kipkong’ nyoo mā ēēr paani iyootēy akiikārēy kurkat.
144.en: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

151.enb: Wuunō ēēruunēkuuk saayit aka tōkōl nkōō sāpuni…
151.en: Always wash your hands with soap…

163.enb: Nēē mārēy isōwu ng’al chaa chaang’ akipō kōrōōyi isooman yi
163.en: Read the articles for more tips!
